newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia Aug palm oil output seen up seven pct.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia Aug palm oil output seen up seven pct.

text.p: Malaysia's palm oil output in August is expected to rise by seven percent to 772,000 tonnes over July, crop forecaster Ivan Wong said on Wednesday.
Wong forecast palm oil stocks at end-August at 805,000-815,000 tonnes and exports of processed palm oil in August at 625,000-630,000 tonnes.
The official Palm Oil Registration and Licensing Authority (PORLA) put stocks at end-July at 754,634 tonnes and July exports at 644,000 tonnes.

Wong said in a report that latest indications for this month pointed to a continued modest seasonal increase in output in Peninsular Malaysia while East Malaysia would see a moderate recovery. "Rainfall has increased since last week with coverage of up to 80 percent in some crop areas on some days," he said.

Wong said palm oil stocks were unlikely to rise to or exceed the one million tonne mark this year. "Stocks will not reach worrisome levels as long as palm oil prices remain competitive in relation to other major oils and fats," he said.
Wong added that he expected exports to be sustainable up to October or until the end of the peak crop period.
Malaysia crude palm oil supply-demand estimate/projection as of August 21, 1996. (All figures in '000 tonnes)
